pullrequest.title: cpu cases now included when configured by yaml

content.raw:
Looks good to me! I have two questions about the compliance of sensor positioning though.

1. Does the sdf of compliance need to be changed now? Or is this going to be accepted? This configuration passed the compliance test.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/3204265061-CPU_Cases_Conflict.jpg)
_Figure 1: “Compliant” configuration with cpu cases_

---

‌

2\. This may not be in this PR scope, but here are the outputs from compliant and non-compliant configurations. It is very clear that the first one was successful and the second one has errors. However for the average user, it may not be clear when they see both “ERRORS” and “successfully generated”, and we don’t want them to need to view the wiki to understand. They probably will not fully understand the difference between a compliant configuration and a non-compliant configuration that still creates a urdf.

Could we add a small sentence clarifying this point? So rather than “urdf file successfully generated.” for both cases, we can either say:

“This sensor and thruster configuration is NOT compliant with the \(current\) VRX constraints. A urdf file will still be created, but please note that the above errors must be fixed for this to be a valid configuration for the VRX competition.

The WAM-V urdf file was successfully generated.”

OR

“This sensor and thruster configuration is compliant with the \(current\) VRX constraints.

The WAM-V urdf file was successfully generated.”

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/1613403110-Successful_WAMV.png)
_Figure 2: Compliant WAM-V Configuration_

---

‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/2992322804-Generate_WAMV_Non-Compliant.png)
_Figure 3: Non-compliant WAM-V Configuration_

Looks good to me! I have two questions about the compliance of sensor positioning though.

  1. Does the sdf of compliance need to be changed now? Or is this going to be accepted? This configuration passed the compliance test.

Figure 1: “Compliant” configuration with cpu cases

‌

2. This may not be in this PR scope, but here are the outputs from compliant and non-compliant configurations. It is very clear that the first one was successful and the second one has errors. However for the average user, it may not be clear when they see both “ERRORS” and “successfully generated”, and we don’t want them to need to view the wiki to understand. They probably will not fully understand the difference between a compliant configuration and a non-compliant configuration that still creates a urdf.

Could we add a small sentence clarifying this point? So rather than “urdf file successfully generated.” for both cases, we can either say:

“This sensor and thruster configuration is NOT compliant with the (current) VRX constraints. A urdf file will still be created, but please note that the above errors must be fixed for this to be a valid configuration for the VRX competition.

The WAM-V urdf file was successfully generated.”

OR

The WAM-V urdf file was successfully generated.”
